name: concrete production, 30MPa, for building construction, with cement, CEM III/A | concrete, 30MPa | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25441/documentation

This dataset is a copy of the corresponding BR dataset.

From reception of raw materials at the ready-mix plant gate.

This activity ends before the delivery of concrete at the construction site. The dataset includes the whole manufacturing processes to produce ready-mixed concrete, internal processes (material handling and mixing) and infrastructure. Water used for cleaning the truck and waste water were also accounted for.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2395:Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Literature data are from 2015 and mix designs were provided in 2017
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Brazilian data. For some exchanges GLO values have been used as proxy. Data quality indicators adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical technology for average Brazilian production.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data from a relatively small sample concentrated in the Southeastern region of Brazil are used to represent the Brazilian concrete production. Some flows have been kept as in the dataset "concrete production, 30-32 MPa, RNA only, GLO, 2006-2006", but uncertainties were adjusted accordingly. This dataset is a copy of the corresponding BR dataset.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data on concrete mixes are a weighted average of 4 concrete ready mix facilities of 4 different companies. For other flows, the weighted average was calculated from several different concrete plants (26 for process water, 34 for rubber parts and lubricating oil, 29 for electricity), belonging to one of the 7 concrete making companies that provided data. Basic uncertainty was calculated from the coefficient of variation of the sample. Diesel consumption and waste generation values were taken from a published paper. For other materials used for maintenance (steel parts) and infrastructure, data were extrapolated from the dataset "concrete production, 30-32 MPa, RNA only, GLO, 2006-2009" (accessed 10.10.2017). No conversion to the geometric mean of the lognormal distribution was done, for consistency reasons with other ecoinvent datasets. Representativeness is of 6,67% based on the number of companies that provided concrete mix data (4) divided by the total number of ready-mix concrete production companies in Brazil (60), which is the number of respondant companies in the national survey carried out by ABCP in 2013.

exchanges.description: 30 MPa concrete is intended for building structures in general, not exposed to freeze-thaw, including residential, commercial and industrial uses.
